Generation II.Gold: This powerful Pok é mon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies then lifts and throws them.
Generation II.Silver: Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.

(Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe's grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This Pok é mon even has enough power to topple a massive tree.
Generation III.Sapphire: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pok é mon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.
Generation III.Emerald: They gather in forests seeking the sweet sap of trees. It is completely clad in a steel-hard shell. It is proud of its horn, which it uses to fling foes.
Generation III.FireRed: Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.
Generation III.LeafGreen: This powerful Pok é mon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

Generation IV.Diamond: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It's strong enough to hurl foes.
Generation IV.Pearl: With powerful legs and claws, it generates enough power to hurl foes over great distances.
Generation IV.Platinum: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
Generation IV.HeartGold: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It is usually docile, but if it is disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.

Generation VI.X: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
Generation VI.Y: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe's grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This Pokémon even has enough power to topple a massive tree.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It can grip things with its two horns and lift 500 times its own body weight.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: A tremendous influx of energy builds it up, but when Mega Evolution ends, Heracross is bothered by terrible soreness in its muscles.

Generation VIII.Sword: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It's strong enough to hurl foes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its powerful legs and claws give it enough power to hurl foes over great distances.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
Generation IX.Violet: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
